Topic.Title: Google's big event on October 29: a FULL plate.....

Message.Msg: By "exact same building", you mean both fabbed by TSMC. Probably not made on the same fab line. And, except for the processor core, completely unrelated designs. A single A9 running at 800MHz isn't in the same class #$%$ core Tegra 3. The Tegra has four A9 cores running at up to twice the clock rate. And the Tegra has far more sophisticated clock gating and power islands. Along with the fifth core, this allows the Tegra to use substantially less power for most workloads.

Message.Title: Nexus new models......where's Tegra?
Message.Msg: The report from “a source with knowledge of Google’s plans” includes ample detail, including apparent confirmation that a 32GB version of the Nexus 7 will be unveiled, which is a widely anticipated move. New, however, is the suggestion that we’ll also see another version of the 32GB model that includes a 3G, HSPA+ antenna for on-the-go connectivity. Google’s Nexus line has been Wi-Fi-only until now, a considerable disadvantage relative to competing products like the iPad for frequent travelers. There’s also a report that Samsung will produce a new 10-inch Nexus tablet for Google, running Android 4.2 and boasting a 2560×1600 display, with an iPad Retina display-beating pixel density of around 300ppi, according to TNW. Also in the Nexus line, the LG Nexus smartphone is reportedly specced as has been reported previously, and will also be powered by Android 4.2, which brings new features like a user account control mechanism that allows for different profiles to provide access to different apps and services on the same shared device.

Topic.Title: Google's big event on October 29: a FULL plate.....

Message.Msg: So what you're sayin' is, that nvidia has Nothing to offer Google. Nada. For their new $99 Nexus 7 tablet. Which the the WonderMedia Technologies PRIZM WM8950 ARM CPU plus Mali GPU has won. And the nvidia Tegra, well, didn't. So when that $99 Nexus 7 tablet -- with that WonderMedia chip inside -- Sprints to the Top of the Volume Board with Millions upon Millions Sold, don't be whining or complaining. Oh no no no. No whining or complaining permitted. 'Cause Jen has no parts to offer Google for their $99 Nexus 7 tablet, remember?

Topic.Title: Nexus new models......where's Tegra?

Message.Msg: Our best sympathies go out to nvidia baggies. On losing-out on All the new Google mobile devices. The new $99 Nexus 7 tablet -- Google went with a China-based WonderMedia Technologies PRIZM WM8950 single-core 800 MHz Cortex-A9 CPU with Mali-400 Graphics Processing Unit. The new co-branded Samsung Nexus 10 tablet -- Will use a Samsung Exynos 5 processor. The new LG Nexus 4 smartphone -- Qualcomm Snapdragon quad-core 1.5 GHz processor. Again, our best sympathies go out to nvidia baggies. On losing-out on All the new Google mobile devices.

Topic.Title: Wu : Microsoft Is Charging Way Too Much for the Surface. Doomed to come In 4th Place at Best

Message.Msg: "Surface's high pricing could prove to be a Fatal Mistake, and relegate it to be a niche No. 4 or No. 5 player. We believe Nexus 7 and Kindle Fire HD will likely see considerably higher volume given their low $199 price points... with [the Genuine Apple] iPad retaining its commanding No. 1 position. (He thinks Microsoft should have charged $300 for the Surface plus the cover.) He also says that supply chain checks suggest Microsoft is only making 2-3 million Surfaces, which will automatically limit sales versus Apple, Google, and Amazon. In other words, Microsoft is going to Fail to sell a lot of Surface tablets, while at the same time limiting the sales of its partners." Looks like its time for the analysts to adjust their nvda spreadsheets again. What with the Microsoft Surface doomed to come In 4th Place. At Best.

Topic.Title: A cheap Genuine Apple iPad Mini : "The Competition's Worst Nightmare"

Message.Msg: Too bad nvidia's parts aren't IN the new Google mobile devices. Nope. nvidia lost them all. 1. The new high volume $99 Nexus 7 tablet -- Google decided to use a China-based WonderMedia Technologies PRIZM WM8950 single-core 800 MHz Cortex-A9 CPU with Mali-400 Graphics Processing Unit -- instead of the nvidia Tegra. 2. The new Samsung Nexus 10 tablet -- Google will use a Samsung Exynos 5 processor. 3. The new LG Nexus 4 smartphone -- Qualcomm Snapdragon quad-core 1.5 GHz processor. Be sure to enjoy the NYC Google launch event anyway, boys.

Topic.Title: Google to announce 4 devices on October 29, two of which are powered by NVIDIA Tegra 3

Message.Msg: Substituting a memory chip in one, and adding yesterday's 3G radio to another does not constitute a "new product". But Google DOES have three (3) Truly New mobile products being launched. And nvidia lost All of them. 1. The new high volume $99 Nexus 7 tablet -- Google decided to use a China-based WonderMedia Technologies PRIZM WM8950 single-core 800 MHz Cortex-A9 CPU with Mali-400 Graphics Processing Unit -- instead of the nvidia Tegra. 2. The new Samsung Nexus 10 tablet -- Google will use a Samsung Exynos 5 processor. 3. The new LG Nexus 4 smartphone -- Qualcomm Snapdragon quad-core 1.5 GHz processor. Be sure to celebrate that new memory chip, boys.

Topic.Title: nvidia's 2012 market share for smartphones? -- 00.90% -- Ha ha ha ha!

Message.Msg: The Accountants define an "immaterial" amount as being less than 5%, right? They sure do. Take a green eye-shade look, boys. Google this : The New Importance of Materiality So with the teensy-tiny Tegra (the T³). having only 00.90% market share for smartphones, the Tegra's market share is, by definition, "immaterial". And the little Tegra's market share could grow by 550%, and the Accountants would still call it "immaterial". 550% growth, boys. And the T³ still wouldn't have a material amount of the market.

Message.Title: Attention Institutional Holders : Only 12 trading days left for VWAP sales.
Message.Msg: Jen's 3Q confessional is scheduled for November 8th, right? It sure is. So let's say you're a Jumbo Elephantine holder of nvda stock. And, well, you'd rather not be. Perhaps you should put that crabcake fork and glass of marvelous California Chardonnay down -- and take a look at the calendar. Only twelve (12) trading days left, right? Just 12 days. And the VWAPers limit your sell orders to 8% of the average daily volume, right? Just 8%. And there's only so many Jumbo Elephantine holders that can fit through the narrow VWAP exit door. Oh so narrow. And as always -- the first ones out get the best and highest prices.
